text: eight years in office and lots of
decisions does President Obama have any
regrets
well we couldn't ask him directly but he
had spoken about regrets in the past
here's a few of them Libya last year a
Fox News host asked Obama a simple
question where's miss Dyke probably
failing to plan for the day after what I
think was the right thing to do in
intervening in Libya Obama told The
Atlantic magazine he misjudged two
things first how much tribal divisions
would play a role in post-qaddafi Libya
in second how little he'd be able to
rely on France in the UK to help rebuild
the country of course those governments
didn't quite see it that way
guns a lot of mass shootings happened on
Obama's watch here he is in 2015 talking
to the BBC the one area where I feel
that I've been most frustrated and most
INEC we do not have sufficient
common-sense gun safety laws even in the
face of repeated mass killings
partisanship here's the president a year
ago giving his last State of the Union
speech it's one of the few regrets of my
presidency that the rancor and suspicion
between the parties has gotten worse
instead of better I have no doubt a
president with the gifts of Lincoln or
Roosevelt might have better bridged the
divide
now funnily enough on this issue Obama
really seems to compare himself to his
predecessors the president later told
Vanity Fair that maybe he could have
gotten more done if he'd had the genius
of Abraham Lincoln the charm of FDR the
energy of Teddy Roosevelt or the
legislative acumen of LBJ guant√°namo
Obama campaigned on a promise to close
the Guantanamo Bay prison of course it's
still open and president-elect Trump
wants to keep it that way and we'll get
a loaded up with some bad dudes believe
me we're gonna load it up so when a
seventh grader in Ohio asked Obama what
he wished he done differently on his
first day in office hey what a close
Guantanamo on the first day I didn't
because at that
time as you'll recall we had a
bipartisan agreement that it should be
closed and I thought that we had enough
consensus there that we could do it in a
more deliberate fashion finally Syria
Syria Obama has said haunts him
constantly
but he told Vanity Fair that he doesn't
necessarily regret how he's handled the
conflict still he said quote I do ask
myself was there something that we
hadn't thought of was there some move
that is beyond what was being presented
to me that maybe a Churchill could have
seen or an Eisenhower might have figured
out no doubt President Obama will
reflect on his decisions for the rest of
his life so will we and so will history
